body_html:
@tatatodd, PYTHONPATH is a export variable where python looks for all module files. If I export this to my tensorflow src folder path then I start getting error for all other python modules like numpy etc.
So, this can't work because it will change the default path where python looks for other modules.
body_text:
@tatatodd, PYTHONPATH is a export variable where python looks for all module files. If I export this to my tensorflow src folder path then I start getting error for all other python modules like numpy etc.
So, this can't work because it will change the default path where python looks for other modules.
body:
@tatatodd, PYTHONPATH is a export variable where python looks for all module files. If I export this to my tensorflow src folder path then I start getting error for all other python modules like numpy etc.
So, this can't work because it will change the default path where python looks for other modules.
